head.title: Batter Up! The Battle of New York Is at Hand

hedline.hl1: Batter Up! The Battle of New York Is at Hand

abstract.p: Angelo Castillo letter comments on October 19 article on upcoming Subway World Series between New York Yankees and New York Mets

block.p: Re ''It's Root, Root, Root, but for Which Team?'' (front page, Oct. 19):
Re ''It's Root, Root, Root, but for Which Team?'' (front page, Oct. 19):
Face it, baseball in New York is more than just a game; it's a way of life.

As kids, New Yorkers declare their allegiance to either the Mets or the Yankees -- an obligation that often gets passed down from generation to generation. To say that you just like the game, that you like both teams and don't care which one wins, is to cop out.

It's about hot, lazy August afternoons -- days so hot that the asphalt melts on your shoes. It's about who you were with and what went through your mind in 1969 the instant the Mets became world champions.
As I prepare for this World Series, my thoughts are of New York and what an amazing place it is. May the best team win. But regardless of the outcome, New York is the winner.
ANGELO CASTILLO Pembroke Pines, Fla., Oct. 19, 2000
